scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This slide collection consists primarily of wild life and nature scenes in Virginia, North Carolina, and West Virginia.

Of special interest is a series devoted to the effects and repair of the Rockfish River area in Nelson County, Virginia, battered by Hurricane Camille. The slides detail the damage and ecological changes, 1969- 1990, wrought by the hurricane.

Other subjects include the South Pacific, particularly New Zealand and Tahiti; astronomy, particularly the building of an observatory and a 1970 eclipse; animals in the San Diego zoo; and the construction of a small bridge.
These slides feature a telescope, moon, eclipse, Haley's Comet, sunsets and sunrises.
These slides feature the damage and repair of Rockfish River, Nelson County after Hurricane Camille.
These slides feature scenes from New Zealand and Tahiti, including, flowers, a lagoon, a luau, a drive around the island, Rotarua and Maori artifacts, and Palmerston and Tekapo.
These slides feature the Yorktown onion, trillium, orchid, fox glove, and West Virginia.
These slides feature sassafras, amaryllis, pansies, beebalm, orchid, azalea, sumac, and firepink.
These slides feature butterfly weed, trillium, roses, firepink, bluebells, thistle, and mushrooms.
These slides feature moths, woodchuck, hummingbirds, snakes, bugs, a butterfly, ducks, birds, worms, and San Diego Zoo animals.
These slides feature flowers, mushrooms and parkway in Boone, North Carolina.
These slides feature Grandfather's Mountain in Boone, North Carolina.
These slides feature Spruce Knob, West Virginia.
These photographs feature construction of an observatory, an eclipse, and the Langley Astronomy Club building.
These photographs feature Rockfish River flood damage and the construction of a bridge.
These photographs feature Parkway, Rockfish River, and Thunder Ridge.
